issue.title: [CF 579] How to do this?
issue.body:
say there are four debuffs (A B C D) may appear on the target

in my current setting, I created four icons and one for each of four debuffs

can I create a kind of icons like this

create four but do not specifically assign the DEBUFF (one of A B C D) into the icon.
In stead, just "tell" them there are four DEBUFFs I wanna see
Then if a Debuff (no matter it is A, B, C or D) found on the target, it will be shown in the first icon; if there are two, they will be shown in the first two icons and so on.


> Posted by CurseForge user a1204350 | Imported from CurseForge issue #579 | Raw

comments.body:
It seems like what you are asking for is to be able to use TellMeWhen as a buff mod like SBF or EBB (or the default Blizzard frames, or any unit frame mod). Such functionality is beyond the scope of what TellMeWhen is intended to do, so no, this is not possible.

Please correct me if I'm wrong about what you are trying to do here, though.

Edited Sep 4, 2012

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Actually if we're dealing with just 4 debuffs then this is perfectly possible. Just create a new group and add all 4 debuffs as separate icons (which I believe you already did.) Then go to group settings/Icon sorting and choose "Shown (Respect Always Hide)" instead of "Icon ID". The high/low duration checkbox will then control if the group is growing left to right or right to left.
